description.raw:
This is a test model of a breakable wall panel. It requires the BreakableJoint plugin from [gazebo pull request 865](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/865/breakable-joint-plugin/diff). It consists of a 10x10 array of cubes, attached to the world via a fixed joint (technically revolute joints with joint limits allowing zero rotation). Each joint has a joint force-torque sensor with the BreakableJoint plugin attached. When the sensor detects a force greater than the breaking force, the joint is detached.

The dynamic behavior of the joints can be adjusted with the `<erp>`, `<cfm>`, and `<breaking_force_N>` parameters.

The `model.sdf` was generated from the very compact `model.rsdf` using embedded ruby:
~~~
erb model.rsdf > model.sdf
~~~
This is a very exciting way to parameterize models, and we are planning to use it more in the future.

title: Test model for breakable walls
